item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2696; text as passed Senate: CR S2696; text of measure as introduced: CR S2691)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2696; text as passed Senate: CR S2696; text of measure as introduced: CR S2691)

summary.text: Expresses condolences to the victims of Hurricane Rita on the six-month anniversary of the disaster. Commends the resiliency and courage of the people of Louisiana and Texas. Expresses the Senate's commitment to providing necessary resources and to standing by the people of those states in relief, recovery, and rebuilding efforts.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses condolences to the victims of Hurricane Rita on the six-month anniversary of the disaster. Commends the resiliency and courage of the people of Louisiana and Texas. Expresses the Senate's commitment to providing necessary resources and to standing by the people of those states in relief, recovery, and rebuilding efforts.

bill.title: A resolution recognizing the victims of Hurricane Rita 6 months after the disaster, commending the resiliency of the people of Southwest Louisiana and Southeast Texas, and committing to stand by them in their relief and rebuilding efforts.

item.title: A resolution recognizing the victims of Hurricane Rita 6 months after the disaster, commending the resiliency of the people of Southwest Louisiana and Southeast Texas, and committing to stand by them in their relief and rebuilding efforts.

A resolution recognizing the victims of Hurricane Rita 6 months after the disaster, commending the resiliency of the people of Southwest Louisiana and Southeast Texas, and committing to stand by them in their relief and rebuilding efforts.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
